    • foodController

      String foodController(InventoryRepository repository)
      This is the constructor for the food controller it takes in a repositoy from the sql database specifically the inventory table
      Parameters:

    • Inventory

      @GetMapping String Inventory(org.springframework.ui.Model model)

    • order

      @PostMapping String order(@RequestParam("new-quantity") String amount, @RequestParam("item-id") String id, @RequestParam("item-name") String name, @RequestParam("item-unit") String unit, @RequestParam("item-low") String low, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      this is the method that modifies an entry in the inventory including ordering more stock
      Parameters:
      amount - amount the user wants to order to add to the inventory
      id - this is the id of the inventory item
      name - this is the new name the manager enters
      unit - this is the new unit type the manager enters
      low - this is the new low threshold the manager wants to enter
      model - this is the model that is being modified by all these changes, this is where the html connects from the database so updating this is updating what the html recives.
      Returns:
      this method returns a redirect to the html page to update the data changed

    • add

      @PostMapping("/add") String add(@RequestParam("item-name") String name, @RequestParam("item-unit") String unit, @RequestParam("item-low") String low, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      this is the logic behind adding a new item to the inventory
      Parameters:
      name - this is the name of the new inventory item
      unit - this is the unit of the new inventory item
      low - this is the low threshold of the new inventory item
      model - this is the model that is being modified by all these changes, this is where the html connects from the database so updating this is updating what the html recives.
      Returns:
      this returns a path to the html file

    • delete

      @ResponseBody @DeleteMapping(value="/{id}", produces="text/html") String delete(@PathVariable Long id)
      this is the method that deletes an inventory item from the database
      Parameters:
      id - this is the id of the inventory item that needs to be delted
      Returns:
      this returns nothing because we do not want to return any html, we just want to delete an item, if the item is in a product you cannot delete it, so i return html that tells the user why it cannot be deleted

    • handleException

      public String handleException(Long id, Exception e)
      Parameters:
      id - the id value of the inventory item
      e - the exception that is caught
      Returns:
      if the item is in a product you cannot delete it, so i return html that tells the user why it cannot be deleted
